entry.title: Integration between S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and a bank using SFTP
entry.content:
Dear Community,

First of all, I’d like to thank you for taking the time to read this post.

I would like to ask if any of you have implemented an integration between S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and a bank’s server. How did this development start initially?

From what I understand, it involves scope item 1EG, which includes a WSDL service (BANKSTATEMENTPOST_IN) with a predefined structure. After that, should this structure be transformed into a .txt file format to be sent to the bank via SFTP?

I’m attaching a basic and initial overview of how the process might look. I’d greatly appreciate it if you could share any reference materials or experiences you might have.

Best regards,
Jordano

entry.title: At least one IBP Write Batch could not be created" during IBP master data upload via CI
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts,

I'm trying to load LOCATION master data from SAP Integration Suite (CPI) to SAP IBP using the IBP Write API.

In my integration flow, I first create the batch using this payload:

Then I use a Groovy script to convert CSV to JSON and wrap it in the following payload:

However, I get the following error:
javax.script.ScriptException: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.Exception: At least one IBP Write Batch could not be created.

I have verified:

  • BatchKey is the same in both steps.

  • CSV structure and field names are correct.

  • IBP destination in BTP is properly configured.

  • The user has the required roles (SAP_IBP_INTEGRATION) and access to planning area ZHCRVRDEM.

Can someone help me understand why the batch creation might be failing? How can I trace this better or fix it?

Thanks in advance!

 



SAP Integration Suite SAP Integrated Business Planning SAP Integration Suite, managed gateway for spend management and SAP Business Network

entry.title: Need Help Saving Data Before SAP BTP Integration Suite Trial Expiry
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am currently using the SAP BTP Trial account with Integration Suite (Cloud Integration/CPI) enabled. I received a notification that my trial will expire in 6 days, and I would like to safely back up or export all my work (iFlows, Groovy scripts, value mappings, configurations, etc.) before the tenant is deactivated.

Here are my questions:

  1. What is the recommended approach to back up and restore iFlows (including scripts and settings)?

  2. Are there any tools or automation options to export multiple iFlows at once?

  3. Is there any way to request a trial extension, or must I create a new account?

  4. Will I have any access after expiry (read-only or grace period), or is everything permanently deleted?

I want to continue my learning journey and build more advanced integrations. If there’s any advice from others who migrated from one trial to another or upgraded, I’d appreciate the guidance!

Thanks in advance 🙏

entry.title: Amazon Punchout integration with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I have a scenario where I have to integrate Amazon Punchout with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system. I checked few Amazon Business documentation and they have provided process of integration with SAP Ariba and SAP SRM but not with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. 

I have below queries for this integration-

1. How the catalog data is called from SAP system as we do not have any store to maintain catalogs in SAP system

2. How the integration between Amazon and SAP will be done via SAP CPI. Is there any setup guide provided by SAP/Amazon?

Note - I have a set-up guide from Amazon, but few details like Network ID etc is missing in that ?

Please do let me know if anyone has done this integration with SAP S/4HANA System.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP Integration Suite

Thanks,

Aman Mittal

entry.title: how can I resolve 'subscription failed' error while trying to create Integration Suite Trial sub.
How to schedule integrations after SuccessFactors Employee central data centers move to UTC time zon
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

Considering the fact that all SuccessFactors data centers have moved to the UTC time zone, how can one schedule Cloud platform integrations to correctly pick up records that have become effective on a certain day?

Details - Let's assume my SF EC data center is in Tokyo. And let's also assume that I run my HRIS synch at 1 AM UTC, which is 10 AM JST. The future dated Job information records will become current dated only after the HRIS sync (I could be wrong here). So, in this case, only if I run the integration after 1:15 UTC (10:15 AM JST) will the integration pick up all the records that have become effective on that day. If I run the integration at around 4 AM, the UTC time is still 7 PM the previous day and it won't pick up the records that have become effective on the current day. 

Is there a solution to this? How can I manage to pick up all the records that have become effective on a certain day (along with changes since the last time the integration ran), when I run the integration early in the morning, when it's still the previous day in UTC time zone?

I am currently using Compound Employee SOAP call with last modified on and fromDate/toDate filters. 

Thanks

Kriba

entry.title: SAP CPI – How to Avoid Escaping XML-Like Strings Inside JSON/XML Fields During Message Mapping
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m facing an issue in SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) where my integration needs to pass an XML-formatted string as part of the payload, but CPI escapes all angle brackets (<, >) during processing. This causes problems on the receiving end, which expects raw XML-like data inside a single tag, not escaped or parsed.

🔍Scenario:

I receive a JSON payload that contains a field like this:

 
<li-code lang="json">
{ "MessageBody": "<STATUS><CODE>200</CODE><MESSAGE>Success</MESSAGE></STATUS>" }​


When this is passed through the standard JSON to XML conversion in CPI, the resulting XML is:

<MessageBody><STATUS><CODE>200</CODE><MESSAGE>Success</MESSAGE></STATUS></MessageBody>

However, what I actually need is:

<MessageBody><STATUS><CODE>200</CODE><MESSAGE>Success</MESSAGE></STATUS></MessageBody>

But I do not want CPI to interpret this as a nested XML structure that generates child nodes like MessageBody/STATUS/CODE/... in the XSD. I want MessageBody to remain a flat string field, preserving its XML-like content as a raw string.

Goal:

  • Treat the content of MessageBody as a plain string, not XML structure.

  • Avoid escaping of <, > symbols.

  • Ensure that the target schema sees MessageBody as a single flat field, not a complex nested element.

    What I Tried:

    I tried using CDATA in my groovy script but after the message mapping step the value results in escaped characters.

     
def body = message.getBody(String)
def wrapped = "<MessageBody><![CDATA[${body}]]></MessageBody>."

Would appreciate any ideas, workarounds, or best practices others have used in similar scenarios.

Thanks in advance! 🙏

entry.title: Groovy scrit error when canonicalize XML subtree
entry.content:
Introduction:

I'm now using the groovy in SAP integration suite(CPI) to do the XML signature, but when it comes to the canonicalizeSubtree() step, I got an element type unacceptable error which detail described as below.

Additionally, I had implement the same Java logic in my computer, with no accident, it can run sucessfully.

Error message:

This is the error message I got in CPI runtime:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: No signature of method: org.apache.xml.security.c14n.Canonicalizer.canonicalizeSubtree() is applicable for argument types: (com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.dom.DeferredElementNSImpl)

Any tips or advise are fully appreciated

SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration

entry.title: Handling inventory updates from EWM to S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in 7L1 integration scenario
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m working on an integration between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP EWM on Private Cloud, using the 7L1 scope item and communication scenario SAP_COM_0A58.

The standard delivery-based processes (inbound, outbound, stock transport orders) are working fine. However, we’re facing challenges with warehouse-driven updates that need to be reflected back in ERP.

Examples of limitations we’re encountering:

  • Pick Denial
    When picking in EWM is partially denied, the reduced quantity is not reflected in the outbound delivery in ERP. This can cause inconsistencies in fulfillment and invoicing.

  • Physical Inventory Differences
    When a cycle count is processed and differences are posted in EWM, the updated stock quantity is not synchronized back to ERP. The ERP stock remains unchanged.

  • Ready for Shipping status
    When the goods are packed or staged in EWM, the “Ready for Shipping” status is not updated in the ERP delivery.

According to SAP Note 3629180:

SAP clearly states these processes are not supported in the standard 7L1 integration.

I’ve come across several discussions and documents suggesting that these types of updates could be solved via custom SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) flows for example, by pushing events from EWM and updating ERP via exposed APIs.

My question:

  • Is CPI indeed the recommended workaround for synchronizing EWM status and inventory changes to ERP in this scenario?

  • Are there any best practices, alternative approaches, or roadmap items to cover these types of back-synchronizations?

  • How are other customers or partners solving this in mixed EWM decentralized + S/4HANA Public Cloud environments?

Any guidance or insights would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Error in calling Outbound Delivery public API in iflow in integration suite
entry.content:
I have created a simple iflow where odata public API API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002 is called in odata v2 receiver adapter to fetch Outbound delivery details from SAP S4 HANA public cloud system. I am able to get Outbound Delivery number using GET call. Now, to fetch item details, in resource path, i selected sub level as 1 and then selected item number field in 'to_DeliveryDocumentItem' sub-level.
Below is the query that is getting generated
$select=DeliveryDocument,to_DeliveryDocumentItem/DeliveryDocument,to_DeliveryDocumentItem/DeliveryDocumentItem&$expand=to_DeliveryDocumentItem&$filter=DeliveryDocument eq '80000000'

No payload is passed to this iflow.

I am getting below error when iflow is triggered through postman
com.sap.it.rt.adapter.http.api.exception.HttpResponseException: An internal server error occured: An exception of type 'WstxUnexpectedCharException' occurred.. cause:com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxUnexpectedCharException: Unexpected character '&' (code 38) (expected a name start character) at [row, col{unknown source}]: [1,182].  The MPL ID for the failed message is : AGiSChZ7DkZ-t0vCX2lUJ7YK8I9d

Kindly help in resolving this issue
